key_title: Key to the species of Brachyscome

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae

source.author: Short, P.S.
source.title: Brachyscome
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Short, P.S. (1999). Brachyscome. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Cypselas 4 or 6-angular, straight or curved, with 1 or 2 variably swollen ridges on each lateral face, lacking wings or wing-like extensions (but sometime coarsely tuberculate)

Cypselas not strongly angular, thin or compressed, longitudinal ridges absent or not swollen (if at all swollen the fruit not manifestly curved and the plants stoloniferous); wings or wing-like extensions present or absent
Lateral faces of cypselas each with a single, swollen longitudinal ridge, and a dense, unbroken line of c. 2 mm long, eglandular hairs; leaf segments linear
Lateral faces of cypselas (at least of disc florets) each with 2 longitudinal ridges, not densely hairy, often the faces tuberculate; leaf segments not linear
Ligules of ray florets no longer than 6 mm in vivo, usually barely esceeding involucre
At least some ligules of ray florets longer than 6 mm (up to 11 mm) long in vivo, distinctly exceeding involucre
Ligules 1.7–2.7 mm long; cypselas black
Ligules more than 4 mm long; cypselas brown, reddish-brown, dark green or black
Leaves mostly entire, linear or narrowly obovate and the cypselas straight and the pappus centrally placed
Leaves all or mostly lobed and/or the cypselas manifestly curved
Bracts 6.5–10.5 mm long; ligules 9–18 mm long
Bracts 1.6–4.1 mm long; ligules less than 6 mm long
Cypselas of disc florets strongly compressed laterally, thin and with entire or lobed wing-like margins which are not demarcated from cypsela body by ridges
Cypselas of disc florets not laterally compressed or if so then wings either absent or demarcated from cypselas body by longitudinal ridges
Annual, glabrous herbs with ligules inconspicuous (0.7–1.3 mm long); pappus absent
Annual or perennial herbs, not glabrous, or if so then then ligules more than 4 mm long; pappus present (but may be inconspicuous)

Cypselas dimorphic, those of disc florets thin and with wing-like margins and those of ray florets lacking wing-like margins or if more or less similar then ligules inconspicuous and less than 2 mm long
Cypselas homomorphic, ligules more than 4 mm long
Weak, glandular-hairy annual; ligules white
Perennial herb, or if appearing annual, then with yellow ligules or an indumentum of cottony hairs
Leaves highly and deeply divided, 1- or 2-pinnatisect
Leaves mostly toothed or shallowly lobed
Stoloniferous perennial herbs, or if seemingly not stoloniferous, then ligules not yellow and cypselas not tuberculate or strongly incurved; ligules white, mauve or blue; pappus to 0.5 mm long
Non-stoloniferous herbs; ligules yellow, at least in bud, if fading to white or pale mauve on opening, then pappus at least 0.5 mm long
Leaves mostly cauline, basal ones not persistent
Leaves mostly basal
Cypsela with the wing-like margins entire or irregularly dissected; indumentum below involucre of coarse (broad-based) glandular hairs
Cypsela with the wing-like margins deeply dissected; indumentum below involucre of fine glandular hairs (riparian plant)
Ray florets white (sometimes mauve beneath); involucral bracts rounded to acute
Ray florets mauve or blue; involucral bracts acute to attenuate
Ligules yellow; indumentum beneath involucre not cottony but of glandular hairs; pappus to 0.3 mm long
Ligules white; indumentum beneath involucre usually conspicuously cottony; pappus 0.5 mm long or more
Cypselas with flat or inflated wing-like or tuberculate margins more than c. a third the width of body, demarcated from body by longitudinal ridges
Cypselas without prominent wing-like or tuberculate margins or if present then not demarcated from the body by longitudinal ridges
Cypselas ± circular in outline, 0.8–1 mm long; plants non-stoloniferous
Cypselas obovate, oblanceolate or oblong, 1.6–3.6 mm long; plants stoloniferous
Cypselas more or less uniformly brown throughout, the wings strongly curved
Cypselas discolorous, with somewhat flat to manifestly curved yellow-brown wings and a dark brown body
Longitudinal ribs on lateral faces of cypsela body wing-like or strongly tuberculate; temperate forest or woodland
Longitudinal ribs on lateral faces of cypsela body rounded, hardly raised; marshy lowlands or alpine
Margins with wings; ligules 7.6–11.5 mm long
Margins with a contiguous series of prominent tubercles; ligules 6.7–7.5 mm long
Cypsela margins an inflated wing
Cypsela margins a thin wing
Leaves entire or mostly so
Leaves all or mostly toothed or lobed
Scapes with glandular hairs
Scapes glabrous
Scapes glabrous
Scapes with glandular hairs
Cypsela body prominently tuberculate
Cypsela body not tuberculate
Mature cypselas commonly black or sometimes very dark brown
Mature cypselas shades of brown and commonly pale brown
Annual or non-woody perennial herb with a usually dense indumentum of glandular and eglandular hairs
Woody-based herb or subshrub, glabrous or almost so
Woody herb or subshrub; anthers lacking terminal appendages
Non-woody herb; anthers with terminal appendages
Leaves entire; ligules white but yellowish on drying (west and north Victoria)
Leaves lobate; ligules mauve (east Gippsland)
Cypselas curved; ligules c. 3–4 mm long
Cypselas flat; ligules 4–12 mm long
Annuals; leaves with long, coarse, eglandular, whitish, septate hairs
Perennials, rarely annual; leaves glabrous or with glandular hairs
Cypsela body dark brown or brownish-black, margins rib-like
Cypsela body pale brown or yellowish-brown, sometimes slightly inflated, margins not forming an obvious rib
Ligules 5–8 mm long; anthers lacking terminal appendages
Ligules 9–11 mm long; anthers with terminal appendages

Leaves entire or the upper margins somewhat serrate; non-stoloniferous, scapiform perennial; involucral bracts usually in 2 series, the outer distinctly shorter than the inner; cypselas with eglandular hairs
Leaves lobed; stoloniferous perennial; involucral bracts in one series of about equal length; cypselas lacking eglandular hairs
Cypselas somewhat inflated (particularly on the margins), often sticky and beset with prominent glandular hairs
Cypselas not obviously inflated, not sticky, glabrous
Leaves linear or linear-oblanceolate, 1–2.5 mm wide; pappus a crown of scale-like bristles 0.1–0.3 mm long; remains of old leaves usually not retained at base of plant
Leaves oblanceolate, 4–12 mm wide; pappus a crown of scale-like bristles barely 0.1 mm high; remains of old leaves retained at base of plant
